content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

```julia
function keep_only_names(words::Vector{String})::Vector{String}
    # Initialize an empty list to store the filtered names
    filtered_names = Vector{String}()

    # Iterate over each word in the original list
    for name in words
        # Check if the first character is uppercase
        if isuppercase(name[1])
            # Append the word to the filtered list if it passes the check
            push!(filtered_names, name)
        end
    end

    return filtered_names
end
```

This function takes a vector of strings `words` and returns a new vector containing only those names that start with a capital letter. It does this by iterating over each word in the original list and checking if the first character is uppercase using `isuppercase(name[1])`. If it is, the word is appended to the filtered list.
